items.title: Bosz rekende op vertrek Veerman, nu staat hij (in het donker) op PSV-veld
items.summary: PSV is begonnen aan het kalenderjaar 2026. Hoe precies? Met Joey Veerman (geen transfer) en Ibi Afellay (nieuwe assistent) binnen de gelederen. Maar ook: met uren vertraging op het vliegveld van Eindhoven en een pikdonker en dus onbespeelbaar veld in Marbella later op de vrijdagavond.

items.title: McIlroy's Boston Common earn first TGL win as Thorbjornsen sparkles
items.summary: Rory McIlroy's Boston Common Golf finally secured their first TGL victory as Michael Thorbjornsen sparkled in a 7-5 triumph over 2025 semi-finalists Los Angeles.

items.title: Sources: Sterling keen on permanent Chelsea exit
items.summary: Raheem Sterling is prioritising a permanent move away from Chelsea this month amid interest from West Ham and Fulham, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: From dartitis to world final - Van Veen 'pinching himself' at Littler showdown
items.summary: Gian van Veen admitted he is "pinching himself" at the prospect of facing Luke Littler in the World Darts Championship final, just years after dartitis left him questioning his future in the sport.

items.title: Van Veen to face Littler in final after Dutchman beats Anderson in epic
items.summary: Luke Littler will take on Gian van Veen in the World Darts Championship final after the Dutchman came through a tough semi-final battle with Gary Anderson to win 6-3 at Alexandra Palace.

items.title: PSG-fans kunnen voor ‚Ç¨800 naar luxe Koeweit-duel, Marseille-aanhang blijft thuis
items.summary: In Frankrijk is er veel te doen om de Franse Supercup (Troph√©e des Champions). Deze wedstrijd wordt namelijk in Koeweit gespeeld. Het zorgt voor veel aversie √©n een gekleurd decor. De fans van Paris Saint-Germain krijgen de kans op een luxe all-inclusive reis, terwijl die van Olympique Marseille thuisblijven.

items.title: Thomas Frank admits ‚Äòit‚Äôs difficult to enjoy‚Äô being Tottenham head coach
items.summary: Frank likens challenges at Spurs to running a marathon Tottenham booed off after goalless draw at Brentford Thomas Frank has admitted he is not enjoying his job at Tottenham. The head coach is dealing with numerous problems as he navigates what always stood to be a transitional season, the most insistent being his team‚Äôs lack of creativity. Spurs were booed off after Thursday‚Äôs 0-0 draw at Brentford by the travelling support, who also chanted ‚Äúboring, boring Tottenham‚Äù. But Frank is confident he will come to look back on the first half of his debut campaign more fondly once ‚Äì and not if ‚Äì his squad emerges on the other side, stronger and wiser for the suffering. Tottenham are 12th in the Premier League ‚Äì their next game is at home to Sunderland on Sunday and Frank leant into a marathon-running analogy when he was asked whether he was enjoying the challenge to which he has signed up. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Nancy leaps to his own defence as he feels Old Firm heat'
items.summary: Just over four weeks on from his appointment as Celtic manager, Wilfried Nancy's passionate defence of his reign shows the pressure he is facing before Saturday's Old Firm derby against Rangers.

items.title: RC Lens najaarskampioen van Frankrijk
items.summary: RC Lens is vrijdagavond (ietwat verlaat) najaarskampioen van Frankrijk geworden. De koploper van Frankrijk won op bezoek bij Toulouse en voert op exact de helft van de competitie de ranglijst aan. Paris Saint-Germain moet nog in actie komen, maar kan niet meer passeren.

items.title: Sutton's predictions v singer-songwriter & Newcastle fan Andrew Cushin
items.summary: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer-songwriter & Newcastle fan Andrew Cushin - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

items.title: Another year, another manager ‚Äì but it is unfair to paint Chelsea‚Äôs project as a flop | Jacob Steinberg
items.summary: Enzo Maresca got the sack because of his actions. That does not mean the club‚Äôs structure needs a complete overhaul Some clubs build around their manager. Eddie Howe is hugely influential at Newcastle and Aston Villa are pretty much Unai Emery FC these days. Chelsea, though, have adopted an alternative model. They have a team of five sporting directors, led by Paul Winstanley and Laurence Stewart, and do not want one person to hold all the power. Yet the question many are asking in the wake of Enzo Maresca‚Äôs demise is whether the template will yield success at the very highest level. It is never quiet at Chelsea. They are often busy in the transfer market, meaning there is an element of players coming and going, and they are now looking for their fifth permanent head coach since a consortium led by Todd Boehly and Clearlake Capital, a private equity firm run by Behdad Eghbali and Jos√© E Feliciano, bought the club from Roman Abramovich in 2022. Continue reading...

items.title: ‚ÄòYou guys kill me‚Äô: Wilfried Nancy hits back at critics before Old Firm battle
items.summary: Celtic manager has lost five of seven games in charge Job under threat if he loses to Rangers on Saturday Wilfried Nancy has launched an impassioned defence of his credentials to manage Celtic, asking his critics to apply context and claiming the media have tried to ‚Äúkill‚Äù him during his troubled early weeks at the club. The reality is that his job will come under serious threat should Celtic lose Saturday‚Äôs Old Firm fixture. The 2-0 loss to Motherwell on Tuesday was the fifth reverse of his seven games in charge. The performance at Fir Park was especially dismal, which raised the latest set of questions about the former Columbus Crew coach‚Äôs suitability for his role. If Rangers win at Celtic Park they would draw level with their oldest foes despite their own unconvincing start to the campaign. Both trail Hearts in the Premiership. Continue reading...

items.title: Villa 'not convinced' to sign Elliott permanently - Emery
items.summary: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery says the club were "not convinced" two months ago to sign Harvey Elliott permanently.
